content:
Here are some important quotes from Husserl's work regarding the natural attitude:

* "The natural standpoint of the everyday man is a pre-philosophical position which never becomes the subject of explicit reflection." (Ideas I, §38)
* "The natural attitude is the seat of all prejudices and errors." (The Crisis of European Sciences and Transcendental Phenomenology, p. 67)
* "The natural attitude posits the world as a realm of being independent of consciousness." (Ideas I, §33)
* "The natural attitude takes it for granted that things are just as they appear to us in perception." (The Crisis of European Sciences and Transcendental Phenomenology, p. 59)
* "The natural attitude fails to recognize the role of consciousness in the constitution of the world." (Ideas I, §38)
